citation: Proclamation under the Nature Conservation Act 2002 (Tas)
text:
Proclamation under the Nature Conservation Act 2002

I, the Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, by this my proclamation made under section 11(2) of the Nature Conservation Act 2002 declare â€“

        (a) the area of Crown land specified in Part 1 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be reserved land in the class of conservation area and give the name Marks Point Conservation Area to that reserved land; and
        (b) the area of Crown land specified in Part 2 of Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be reserved land in the class of conservation area and give the name Prime Seal Island Conservation Area to that reserved land; and
        (c) that this proclamation takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.
11 February 2010

PETER G. UNDERWOOD

Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

D. E. LLEWELLYN

Minister for Primary Industries and Water

SCHEDULE 1 - Area of land

PART 1 - Marks Point Conservation Area

All that area of land comprising about 28.68 hectares, shown as Lot 1 and bounded by a heavy black line, on Plan 7307 in the Central Plan Register, a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Part 1 of Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

PART 2 - Prime Seal Island Conservation Area

All that area of land comprising about 1 360 hectares, shown as Lot 1 and bounded by a heavy black line, on Plan 7845 in the Central Plan Register, a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Part 2 of Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

SCHEDULE 2 - Plan

PART 1 - Marks Point Conservation Area

PART 2 - Prime Seal Island Conservation Area

Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 17 February 2010

This proclamation is administered in the Department of Primary Industries, Parks, Water and Environment.
